null.verse 27:20: En hij overzag de vogelen, en zeide: "Hoe kan het zijn dat ik de hop niet zie? Is hij onder de afwezigen?
null.verse 27:21: Ik zal hem zeker streng straffen of ik zal hem doden, als hij mij geen duidelijke uitleg geeft.
null.verse 27:22: En hij duurde niet lang, totdat deze kwam en zeide: "Ik heb datgene gezien wat je niet weet; en ik heb over Saba betrouwbare inlichtingen meegebracht.
null.verse 27:23: Ik vond een vrouw, die daar regeerde en haar is alles gegeven en zij heeft een machtige troon.
null.verse 27:24: Ik vond, dat zij en haar volk de zon aanbaden in plaats van God en Satan heeft hun werken voor schoonschijnend gemaakt en heeft hun de weg versperd, zodat zij geen rechte leiding volgen;
null.verse 27:25: Zij aanbidden God niet, Die hetgeen in de hemelen en op aarde verborgen is aan het licht brengt en Die weet wat je verbergt en wat je toont.
null.verse 27:26: God! Er is geen God naast Hem, de Heer van de Grote Troon.
null.verse 27:27: Salomo zeide: "Wij zullen zien of je de waarheid hebt gesproken of dat je tot de leugenaars behoort.
null.verse 27:28: Ga met deze mijn brief en leg hem voor hen neder, trek u dan van hen terug, en zie welk antwoord zij terugzenden.
null.verse 27:29: Zij (de Koningin) zeide: "Gij, leiders, er is aan mij een nobele brief afgeleverd.
null.verse 27:30: Hij is van Salomo en luidt: "In naam van God, de Barmhartige, de Genadevolle.
null.verse 27:31: Weest niet laatdunkend tegenover mij maar komt tot mij in onderworpenheid.
null.verse 27:32: Zij zeide: "Gij leiders, geeft mij raad in de zaak die voor mij ligt, ik beslis niets totdat jullie er mee instemmen.
null.verse 27:33: Zij antwoordden: "Wij hebben de macht en wij bezitten een grote dapperheid in de oorlog, maar de zaak is in uw handen; overdenk daarom wat je zult bevelen.
null.verse 27:34: Zij zeide: "Voorzeker, koningen verwoesten een stad als zij er (met geweld) binnen trekken en maken de hoogsten van het volk tot de laagsten.
null.verse 27:35: Maar ik ga hun geschenken sturen en afwachten waarmede de afgevaardigden terugkeren.
null.verse 27:36: Toen de gezant (der koningin) tot Salomo kwam, zeide deze: "Schenk je mij rijkdommen? Maar datgene wat God mij geschonken heeft is beter dan wat Hij u heeft gegeven.
null.verse 27:37: Gaat tot hen terug, want wij zullen zeker tot hen komen met scharen waartegen zij geen macht zullen hebben, wij zullen hen met ontering daaruit (de stad) verdrijven en zij zullen vernederd worden.
null.verse 27:38: Hij (Salomo) zeide: "O edelen, welke onder u zal mij een passende troon voor haar brengen voordat zij onderdanig tot mij komt?"
null.verse 27:39: Een dappere van de djinn zeide: "Ik zal deze tot u brengen voordat je van uw kamp opstaat en zeker heb ik daar macht over en ik ben betrouwbaar.
null.verse 27:40: Iemand, die kennis van het geschrift had zeide: "Ik zal hem tot u brengen vóór uw bode terugkeert," en toen Salomo de troon naast zich zag geplaatst, zeide hij: "Dit is bij de gratie van mijn Heer, opdat Hij mij moge beproeven of ik dankbaar of ondankbaar ben.
null.verse 27:41: En hij (Salomo) zeide: "Zorgt dat haar eigen troon haar tegenstaat.
null.verse 27:42: En toen zij kwam, werd haar gevraagd: "Is uw troon als deze?" Zij antwoordde: "Hij is als het ware dezelfde.
null.verse 27:43: Hij (Salomo) weerhield haar van het aanbidden van hetgeen zij in plaats van God aanbad; want zij behoorde tot een ongelovig volk.
null.verse 27:44: Er werd tot haar gezegd "Ga het paleis binnen.
null.verse 27:45: En Wij zonden zeker tot de Samoed hun broeder Salih, die zeide: "Aanbidt God.
null.verse 27:46: Hij zeide: "O mijn volk, waarom wens je het kwade te verhaasten boven het goede? Waarom vraag je geen vergiffenis aan God, opdat u barmhartigheid betoond moge worden?"
null.verse 27:47: Zij antwoordden: "Wij voorzien kwaad wegens u en degenen die met u zijn.
null.verse 27:48: En er waren negen personen in de stad die onrust in het land stichtten en zich niet wilden verbeteren,
null.verse 27:49: Zij zeiden: "Zweert tot elkander bij God, dat wij zeker Salih en zijn familie in de nacht zullen aanvallen en daarna zullen wij tot zijn bloedverwanten zeggen: "Wij waren geen getuigen van de vernietiging van zijn familie en wij spreken zeker de waarheid.
null.verse 27:50: En zij smeedden een plan, en Wij maakten ook een plan (tegen hen) maar zij bemerkten het niet.
null.verse 27:51: Ziet dan hoe het einde van hun plan was; Wij vernietigden hen en hun volk, allen tezamen.
null.verse 27:52: En dit zijn hun ingestorte huizen omdat zij onrechtvaardig waren.
null.verse 27:53: En Wij redden hen die geloofden en godvrezend waren.
null.verse 27:54: En Lot, toen hij tot zijn volk zeide: "Bega je onzedelijkheid tegen beter weten in?
null.verse 27:55: Nader je wellustig de mannen in plaats van de vrouwen? Neen, je bent een onwetend volk.
null.verse 27:56: Maar het antwoord van zijn volk was niets anders dan dat zij zeiden: "Verdrijft Lot’s familie uit uw stad want zij zijn mensen, die zich rein willen houden.
null.verse 27:57: Daarom redden Wij hem en zijn familie behalve zijn vrouw; Wij deden haar tot de achterblijvenden behoren.
null.verse 27:58: En Wij deden een regen over hen komen, en vreselijk was de regen voor de gewaarschuwden.
null.verse 27:59: Zeg: "Alle lof behoort aan God en vrede zij met Zijn uitverkoren dienaren.
null.verse 27:60: Hij Die de hemelen en de aarde schiep en water uit de hemelen nederzendt waarmee Hij prachtige tuinen doet groeien? Je zou hun bomen niet kunnen doen groeien.
null.verse 27:61: Hij Die de aarde tot een rustplaats maakte, er rivieren in plaatste en er hechte bergen op zette en een dam tussen de beide zeeën? Is er een God naast God? Neen, de meesten hunner (willen) het niet weten.
null.verse 27:62: Hij Die de wanhopige verhoort als deze Hem aanroept, en het kwade wegneemt en u opvolgers op aarde maakt? Is er een God naast God? Hoe weinig lering trek je er uit!
null.verse 27:63: Hij, Die u leidt in het duister van het land en van de zee, en Die u winden zendt als boodschappers van blijde tijdingen (regen) door Zijn barmhartigheid? Is er een God naast God? Verheven is God boven hetgeen zij met Hem vereenzelvigen.
null.verse 27:64: Hij Die de schepping voortbrengt en dat dan herhaalt, en u (voedsel) voorziet uit de hemel en de aarde? Is er een God naast God?" Zeg: "Geeft uw bewijs hiervoor als je waarachtig bent.
null.verse 27:65: Zeg: "Niemand in de hemelen en op aarde kent het onzienlijke, behalve God; en zij weten niet wanneer zij zullen worden opgewekt.
null.verse 27:66: Neen, hun kennis heeft geheel gefaald betreffende het Hiernamaals, neen, zij twijfelen er aan, neen, zij zijn er blind voor.
null.verse 27:67: En de ongelovigen zeggen: "Zullen wij wanneer wij en onze vaderen tot stof zijn geworden inderdaad worden opgewekt?
null.verse 27:68: Er was ons voorheen reeds mede gedreigd, - ons en onze voorvaderen; dit zijn niets dan fabelen der ouden!"
null.verse 27:69: Zeg tot hen: "Reist op aarde en ziet hoe het einde der zondaren was.
null.verse 27:70: En treur niet om hen, noch wees bezorgd voor hun samenzwering.
null.verse 27:71: En zij zullen zeggen: "Wanneer zal deze bedreiging worden vervuld als je de waarheid spreekt?"
null.verse 27:72: Zeg: "Het kan zijn, dat een gedeelte van de straf die je wilde verhaasten, reeds dicht bij u is gekomen.
null.verse 27:73: En waarlijk, uw Heer is goedertieren voor de mensen maar de meesten hunner zijn ondankbaar.
null.verse 27:74: En zeker uw Heer weet alles wat hun hart verbergt en wat het openbaart.
null.verse 27:75: En er is niets in de hemelen of op aarde verborgen, of het staat in een duidelijk boek opgeschreven.
null.verse 27:76: Waarlijk deze Koran legt aan de kinderen van Israël veel uit van hetgeen waaromtrent zij verschillen.
null.verse 27:77: En voorwaar, het is richtsnoer en barmhartigheid voor de gelovigen.
null.verse 27:78: En voorwaar uw Heer zal over hen beslissen door Zijn gebod en Hij is de Almachtige, de Alwetende.
null.verse 27:79: Stel dan uw vertrouwen in God; voorzeker gij bezit de duidelijke Waarheid.
null.verse 27:80: Waarlijk, je kunt de doden, noch de doven de oproep doen horen als Zij zich verwijderen.
null.verse 27:81: Noch kun je de blindeen van hun dwaling afleiden.
null.verse 27:82: En wanneer het Woord voor hun bewaarheid wordt, zullen Wij een dier uit de aarde te voorschijn brengen dat hen zal verwonden, omdat de mensen niet in Onze tekenen geloven.
null.verse 27:83: En op de Dag waarop Wij van elk volk degenen zullen verzamelen die Onze tekenen loochenden, zullen zij in groepen worden bijeengehouden,
null.verse 27:84: Wanneer zij komen, zal Hij zeggen: "Heb je Onze tekenen geloochend voordat je deze trachtte te begrijpen of wat deed je?"
null.verse 27:85: En het oordeel zal op hen vallen wegens hun ongerechtigheid en zij zullen niet kunnen spreken.
null.verse 27:86: Hebben zij niet gezien dat Wij de nacht hebben ingesteld opdat zij er in mogen rusten, en de dag om licht te geven.
null.verse 27:87: En de Dag, waarop de bazuin zal worden geblazen, zullen zij (allen) die in de hemelen en ook zij die op aarde zijn, schrikken, behalve degenen die God wil (sparen).
null.verse 27:88: En je ziet de bergen en je denkt ze onbewegelijk terwijl zij als de wolken voorbijgaan.
null.verse 27:89: Wie een goede daad doet, zal een betere beloning hebben dan deze en zij zullen op die Dag veilig zijn voor schrik.
null.verse 27:90: Maar zij die een slechte daad begaan, zullen op hun aangezicht in het Vuur worden nedergeworpen.
null.verse 27:91: Zeg: "Het is mij geboden alleen de Heer dezer stad die Hij heilig heeft verklaard te aanbidden, en aan Hem behoren alle dingen, en het is mij geboden tot de Moslims te behoren
null.verse 27:92: En de Koran te verkondigen.
null.verse 27:93: En zeg: "Alle eer behoort aan God, Hij zal u Zijn tekenen tonen en je zult ze kennen.

Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 27:2: A guidance and good tidings for believers
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 27:3: Who establish worship and pay the poor-due and are sure of the Hereafter.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 27:4: Lo! as for those who believe not in the Hereafter, We have made their works fairseeming unto them so that they are all astray.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 27:5: Those are they for whom is the worst of punishment, and in the Hereafter they will be the greatest losers.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 27:6: Lo! as for thee (Muhammad), thou verily receivest the Qur’an from the presence of One Wise, Aware.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 27:7: (Remember) when Moses said unto his household: Lo! I spy afar off a fire; I will bring you tidings thence, or bring to you a borrowed flame that ye may warm yourselves.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 27:8: But when he reached it, he was called, saying: Blessed is Whosoever is in the fire and Whosoever is round about it! And Glorified be Allah, the Lord of the Worlds!
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 27:9: O Moses! Lo! it is I, Allah, the Mighty, the Wise.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 27:10: And throw down thy staff! But when he saw it writhing as it were a demon, he turned to flee headlong; (but it was said unto him): O Moses! Fear not! the emissaries fear not in My presence,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 27:11: Save him who hath done wrong and afterward hath changed evil for good.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 27:12: And put thy hand into the bosom of thy robe, it will come forth white but unhurt.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 27:13: But when Our tokens came unto them, plain to see, they said: This is mere magic,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 27:14: And they denied them, though their souls acknowledged them, for spite and arrogance.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 27:15: And We verily gave knowledge unto David and Solomon, and they said: Praise be to Allah, Who hath preferred us above many of His believing slaves!
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 27:17: And there were gathered together unto Solomon his armies of the jinn and humankind, and of the birds, and they were set in battle order;
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 27:18: Till, when they reached the Valley of the Ants, an ant exclaimed: O ants! Enter your dwellings lest Solomon and his armies crush you, unperceiving.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 27:19: And (Solomon) smiled, laughing at her speech, and said: My Lord, arouse me to be thankful for Thy favour wherewith Thou hast favoured me and my parents, and to do good that shall be pleasing unto Thee, and include me in (the number of) Thy righteous slaves.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 27:20: And he sought among the birds and said: How is it that I see not the hoopoe, or is he among the absent ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 27:21: I verily will punish him with hard punishment or I verily will slay him, or he verily shall bring me a plain excuse.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 27:22: But he was not long in coming, and he said: I have found out (a thing) that thou apprehendest not, and I come unto thee from Sheba with sure tidings.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 27:23: Lo! I found a woman ruling over them, and she hath been given (abundance) of all things, and hers is a mighty throne.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 27:24: I found her and her people worshipping the sun instead of Allah; and Satan maketh their works fairseeming unto them, and debarreth them from the way (of Truth), so that they go not aright;
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 27:25: So that they worship not Allah, Who bringeth forth the hidden in the heavens and the earth, and knoweth what ye hide and what ye proclaim,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 27:26: Allah; there is no God save Him, the Lord of the Tremendous Throne.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 27:27: (Solomon) said: We shall see whether thou speakest truth or whether thou art of the liars.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 27:28: Go with this my letter and throw it down unto them; then turn away and see what (answer) they return,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 27:29: (The Queen of Sheba) said (when she received the letter): O chieftains! Lo! there hath been thrown unto me a noble letter.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 27:30: Lo! it is from Solomon, and lo! it is: In the name of Allah, the Beneficent, the Merciful;
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 27:31: Exalt not yourselves against me, but come unto me as those who surrender.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 27:32: She said: O chieftains! Pronounce for me in my case.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 27:33: They said: We are lords of might and lords of great prowess, but it is for thee to command; so consider what thou wilt command.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 27:34: She said: Lo! kings, when they enter a township, ruin it and make the honour of its people shame.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 27:35: But lo! I am going to send a present unto them, and to see with what (answer) the messengers return.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 27:36: So when (the envoy) came unto Solomon, (the King) said: What! Would ye help me with wealth ? But that which Allah hath given me is better than that which He hath given you.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 27:38: He said: O chiefs! Which of you will bring me her throne before they come unto me, surrendering ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 27:39: A stalwart of the jinn said: I will bring it thee before thou canst rise from thy place.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 27:40: One with whom was knowledge of the Scripture said: I will bring it thee before thy gaze returneth unto thee.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 27:41: He said: Disguise her throne for her that we may see whether she will go aright or be of those not rightly guided.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 27:42: So, when she came, it was said (unto her): Is thy throne like this ? She said: (It is) as though it were the very one.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 27:43: And (all) that she was wont to worship instead of Allah hindered her, for she came of disbelieving folk.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 27:44: It was said unto her: Enter the hall.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 27:45: And We verily sent unto Thamud their brother Salih, saying: Worship Allah.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 27:46: He said: O my people! Why will ye hasten on the evil rather than the good ? Why will ye not ask pardon of Allah, that ye may receive mercy.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 27:47: They said: We augur evil of thee and those with thee.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 27:48: And there were in the city nine persons who made mischief in the land and reformed not.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 27:49: They said: Swear one to another by Allah that we verily will attack him and his household by night, and afterward we will surely say unto his friend: We witnessed not the destruction of his household.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 27:50: So they plotted a plot: and We plotted a plot, while they perceived not.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 27:51: Then see the nature of the consequence of their plotting, for lo! We destroyed them and their people, every one.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 27:52: See, yonder are their dwellings empty and in ruins because they did wrong.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 27:53: And we saved those who believed and used to ward off (evil).
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 27:54: And Lot! when he said unto his folk: Will ye commit abomination knowingly ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 27:55: Must ye needs lust after men instead of women ? Nay, but ye are folk who act senselessly.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 27:56: But the answer of his folk was naught save that they said: Expel the household of Lot from your township, for they (forsooth) are folk who would keep clean!
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 27:57: Then We saved him and his household save his wife; We destined her to be of those who stayed behind.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 27:58: And We rained a rain upon them.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 27:59: Say (O Muhammad): Praise be to Allah, and peace be on His slaves whom He hath chosen! Is Allah best, or (all) that ye ascribe as partners (unto Him) ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 27:60: Is not He (best) Who created the heavens and the earth, and sendeth down for you water from the sky wherewith We cause to spring forth joyous orchards, whose trees it never hath been yours to cause to grow.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 27:61: Is not He (best) Who made the earth a fixed abode, and placed rivers in the folds thereof, and placed firm hills therein, and hath set a barrier between the two seas ? Is there any God beside Allah ? Nay, but most of them know not!
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 27:62: Is not He (best) Who answereth the wronged one when he crieth unto Him and removeth the evil, and hath made you viceroys of the earth ? Is there any God beside Allah ? Little do they reflect!
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 27:63: Is not He (best) Who guideth you in the darkness of the land and the sea, He Who sendeth the winds as heralds of His mercy ? Is there any God beside Allah ? High Exalted be Allah from all that they ascribe as partner (unto Him)!
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 27:64: Is not He (best) Who produceth creation, then reproduceth it, and Who provideth for you from the heaven and the earth ? Is there any God beside Allah ? Say: Bring your proof, if ye are truthful!
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 27:65: Say (O Muhammad): None in the heavens and the earth knoweth the Unseen save Allah; and they know not when they will be raised (again).
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 27:66: Nay, but doth their knowledge reach to the Hereafter ? Nay, for they are in doubt concerning it.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 27:67: Yet those who disbelieve say: When we have become dust like our fathers, shall we verily be brought forth (again) ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 27:68: We were promised this, forsooth, we and our fathers.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 27:69: Say (unto them, O Muhammad): Travel in the land and see the nature of the sequel for the guilty!
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 27:70: And grieve thou not for them, nor be in distress because of what they plot (against thee).
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 27:71: And they say: When (will) this promise (be fulfilled), if ye are truthful ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 27:72: Say: It may be that a part of that which ye would hasten on is close behind you.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 27:73: Lo! thy Lord is full of bounty for mankind, but most of them do not give thanks.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 27:74: Lo! thy Lord knoweth surely all that their bosoms hide, and all that they proclaim.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 27:75: And there is nothing hidden in the heaven or the earth but it is in a clear Record.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 27:76: Lo! this Qur’an narrateth unto the Children of Israel most of that concerning which they differ.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 27:77: And lo! it is a guidance and a mercy for believers.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 27:78: Lo! thy Lord will judge between them of His wisdom, and He is the Mighty, the Wise.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 27:79: Therefor (O Muhammad) put thy trust in Allah, for thou (standest) on the plain Truth.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 27:80: Lo! thou canst not make the dead to hear, nor canst thou make the deaf to hear the call when they have turned to flee;
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 27:81: Nor canst thou lead the blind out of their error.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 27:82: And when the word is fulfilled concerning them, We shall bring forth a beast of the earth to speak unto them because mankind had not faith in Our revelations.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 27:83: And (remind them of) the Day when We shall gather out of every nation a host of those who denied Our revelations, and they will be set in array;
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 27:84: Till, when they come (before their Lord), He will say: Did ye deny My revelations when ye could not compass them in knowledge, or what was it that ye did ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 27:85: And the Word will be fulfilled concerning them because they have done wrong, and they will not speak.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 27:86: Have they not seen how We have appointed the night that they may rest therein, and the day sight-giving ? Lo! therein verily are portents for a people who believe.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 27:87: And (remind them of) the Day when the Trumpet will be blown, and all who are in the heavens and the earth will start in fear, save him whom Allah willeth.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 27:88: And thou seest the hills thou deemest solid flying with the flight of clouds: the doing of Allah Who perfecteth all things.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 27:89: Whoso bringeth a good deed will have better than its worth; and such are safe from fear that Day.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 27:90: And whoso bringeth an ill-deed, such will be flung down on their faces in the Fire.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 27:91: (Say): I (Muhammad) am commanded only to serve the Lord of this land which He hath hallowed, and unto Whom all things belong.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 27:93: And say: Praise be to Allah Who will show you His portents so that ye shall know them.

Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 27:1: These are verses of the Qur’an,-a book that makes (things) clear;
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 27:2: A guide: and glad tidings for the believers,-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 27:3: Those who establish regular prayers and give in regular charity, and also have (full) assurance of the hereafter.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 27:4: As to those who believe not in the Hereafter, We have made their deeds pleasing in their eyes; and so they wander about in distraction.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 27:5: Such are they for whom a grievous Penalty is (waiting); and in the Hereafter theirs will be the greatest loss.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 27:6: As to thee, the Qur’an is bestowed upon thee from the presence of one who is wise and all-knowing.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 27:7: Behold! Moses said to his family: "I perceive a fire; soon will I bring you from there some information, or I will bring you a burning brand to light our fuel, that ye may warn yourselves.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 27:8: But when he came to the (fire), a voice was heard: "Blessed are those in the fire and those around: and glory to God, the Lord of the worlds.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 27:9: "O Moses! verily, I am God, the exalted in might, the wise!.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 27:10: "Now do thou throw thy rod!" But when he saw it moving (of its own accord)as if it had been a snake, he turned back in retreat, and retraced not his steps: "O Moses!" (it was said), "Fear not: truly, in My presence, those called as apostles have no fear,-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 27:11: "But if any have done wrong and have thereafter substituted good to take the place of evil, truly, I am Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 27:12: "Now put thy hand into thy bosom, and it will come forth white without stain (or harm): (these are) among the nine Signs (thou wilt take) to Pharaoh and his people: for they are a people rebellious in transgression.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 27:13: But when Our Signs came to them, that should have opened their eyes, they said: "This is sorcery manifest!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 27:14: And they rejected those Signs in iniquity and arrogance, though their souls were convinced thereof: so see what was the end of those who acted corruptly!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 27:15: We gave (in the past) knowledge to David and Solomon: And they both said: "Praise be to God, Who has favoured us above many of his servants who believe!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 27:17: And before Solomon were marshalled his hosts,- of Jinns and men and birds, and they were all kept in order and ranks.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 27:18: At length, when they came to a (lowly) valley of ants, one of the ants said: "O ye ants, get into your habitations, lest Solomon and his hosts crush you (under foot) without knowing it.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 27:19: So he smiled, amused at her speech; and he said: "O my Lord! so order me that I may be grateful for Thy favours, which thou hast bestowed on me and on my parents, and that I may work the righteousness that will please Thee: And admit me, by Thy Grace, to the ranks of Thy righteous Servants.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 27:20: And he took a muster of the Birds; and he said: "Why is it I see not the Hoopoe? Or is he among the absentees?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 27:21: "I will certainly punish him with a severe penalty, or execute him, unless he bring me a clear reason (for absence).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 27:22: But the Hoopoe tarried not far: he (came up and) said: "I have compassed (territory) which thou hast not compassed, and I have come to thee from Saba with tidings true.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 27:23: "I found (there) a woman ruling over them and provided with every requisite; and she has a magnificent throne.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 27:24: "I found her and her people worshipping the sun besides God: Satan has made their deeds seem pleasing in their eyes, and has kept them away from the Path,- so they receive no guidance,-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 27:25: "(Kept them away from the Path), that they should not worship God, Who brings to light what is hidden in the heavens and the earth, and knows what ye hide and what ye reveal.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 27:26: "God!- there is no god but He!- Lord of the Throne Supreme!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 27:27: (Solomon) said: "Soon shall we see whether thou hast told the truth or lied!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 27:28: "Go thou, with this letter of mine, and deliver it to them: then draw back from them, and (wait to) see what answer they return".
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 27:29: (The queen) said: "Ye chiefs! here is delivered to me - a letter worthy of respect.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 27:30: "It is from Solomon, and is (as follows): ’In the name of God, Most Gracious, Most Merciful:
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 27:31: "’Be ye not arrogant against me, but come to me in submission (to the true Religion).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 27:32: She said: "Ye chiefs! advise me in (this) my affair: no affair have I decided except in your presence.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 27:33: They said: "We are endued with strength, and given to vehement war: but the command is with thee; so consider what thou wilt command.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 27:34: She said: "Kings, when they enter a country, despoil it, and make the noblest of its people its meanest thus do they behave.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 27:35: "But I am going to send him a present, and (wait) to see with what (answer) return (my) ambassadors.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 27:36: Now when (the embassy) came to Solomon, he said: "Will ye give me abundance in wealth? But that which God has given me is better than that which He has given you! Nay it is ye who rejoice in your gift!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 27:37: "Go back to them, and be sure we shall come to them with such hosts as they will never be able to meet: We shall expel them from there in disgrace, and they will feel humbled (indeed).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 27:38: He said (to his own men): "Ye chiefs! which of you can bring me her throne before they come to me in submission?"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 27:39: Said an ’Ifrit, of the Jinns: "I will bring it to thee before thou rise from thy council: indeed I have full strength for the purpose, and may be trusted.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 27:40: Said one who had knowledge of the Book: "I will bring it to thee within the twinkling of an eye!" Then when (Solomon) saw it placed firmly before him, he said: "This is by the Grace of my Lord!- to test me whether I am grateful or ungrateful! and if any is grateful, truly his gratitude is (a gain) for his own soul; but if any is ungrateful, truly my Lord is Free of all Needs, Supreme in Honour !"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 27:41: He said: "Transform her throne out of all recognition by her: let us see whether she is guided (to the truth) or is one of those who receive no guidance.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 27:42: So when she arrived, she was asked, "Is this thy throne?" She said, "It was just like this; and knowledge was bestowed on us in advance of this, and we have submitted to God (in Islam).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 27:43: And he diverted her from the worship of others besides God: for she was (sprung) of a people that had no faith.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 27:44: She was asked to enter the lofty Palace: but when she saw it, she thought it was a lake of water, and she (tucked up her skirts), uncovering her legs.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 27:45: We sent (aforetime), to the Thamud, their brother Salih, saying, "Serve God": But behold, they became two factions quarrelling with each other.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 27:46: He said: "O my people! why ask ye to hasten on the evil in preference to the good? If only ye ask God for forgiveness, ye may hope to receive mercy.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 27:47: They said: "Ill omen do we augur from thee and those that are with thee".
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 27:48: There were in the city nine men of a family, who made mischief in the land, and would not reform.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 27:49: They said: "Swear a mutual oath by God that we shall make a secret night attack on him and his people, and that we shall then say to his heir (when he seeks vengeance): ’We were not present at the slaughter of his people, and we are positively telling the truth.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 27:50: They plotted and planned, but We too planned, even while they perceived it not.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 27:51: Then see what was the end of their plot!- this, that We destroyed them and their people, all (of them).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 27:52: Now such were their houses, - in utter ruin, - because they practised wrong-doing.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 27:53: And We saved those who believed and practised righteousness.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 27:54: (We also sent) Lut (as an apostle): behold, He said to his people, "Do ye do what is shameful though ye see (its iniquity)?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 27:55: Would ye really approach men in your lusts rather than women? Nay, ye are a people (grossly) ignorant!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 27:56: But his people gave no other answer but this: they said, "Drive out the followers of Lut from your city: these are indeed men who want to be clean and pure!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 27:57: But We saved him and his family, except his wife; her We destined to be of those who lagged behind.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 27:58: And We rained down on them a shower (of brimstone): and evil was the shower on those who were admonished (but heeded not)!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 27:59: Say: Praise be to God, and Peace on his servants whom He has chosen (for his Message).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 27:60: Or, Who has created the heavens and the earth, and Who sends you down rain from the sky? Yea, with it We cause to grow well-planted orchards full of beauty of delight: it is not in your power to cause the growth of the trees in them.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 27:61: Or, Who has made the earth firm to live in; made rivers in its midst; set thereon mountains immovable; and made a separating bar between the two bodies of flowing water? (can there be another) god besides God? Nay, most of them know not.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 27:62: Or, Who listens to the (soul) distressed when it calls on Him, and Who relieves its suffering, and makes you (mankind) inheritors of the earth? (Can there be another) god besides God? Little it is that ye heed!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 27:63: Or, Who guides you through the depths of darkness on land and sea, and Who sends the winds as heralds of glad tidings, going before His Mercy? (Can there be another) god besides God?- High is God above what they associate with Him!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 27:64: Or, Who originates creation, then repeats it, and who gives you sustenance from heaven and earth? (Can there be another) god besides God? Say, "Bring forth your argument, if ye are telling the truth!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 27:65: Say: None in the heavens or on earth, except God, knows what is hidden: nor can they perceive when they shall be raised up (for Judgment).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 27:66: Still less can their knowledge comprehend the Hereafter: Nay, they are in doubt and uncertainty thereanent; nay, they are blind thereunto!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 27:67: The Unbelievers say: "What! when we become dust,- we and our fathers,- shall we really be raised (from the dead)?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 27:68: "It is true we were promised this,- we and our fathers before (us): these are nothing but tales of the ancients.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 27:69: Say: "Go ye through the earth and see what has been the end of those guilty (of sin).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 27:70: But grieve not over them, nor distress thyself because of their plots.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 27:71: They also say: "When will this promise (come to pass)? (Say) if ye are truthful.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 27:72: Say: "It may be that some of the events which ye wish to hasten on may be (close) in your pursuit!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 27:73: But verily thy Lord is full of grace to mankind: Yet most of them are ungrateful.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 27:74: And verily thy Lord knoweth all that their hearts do hide.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 27:75: Nor is there aught of the unseen, in heaven or earth, but is (recorded) in a clear record.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 27:76: Verily this Qur’an doth explain to the Children of Israel most of the matters in which they disagree.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 27:77: And it certainly is a Guide and a Mercy to those who believe.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 27:78: Verily thy Lord will decide between them by His Decree: and He is Exalted in Might, All-Knowing.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 27:79: So put thy trust in God: for thou art on (the path of) manifest Truth.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 27:80: Truly thou canst not cause the dead to listen, nor canst thou cause the deaf to hear the call, (especially) when they turn back in retreat.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 27:81: Nor canst thou be a guide to the blind, (to prevent them) from straying: only those wilt thou get to listen who believe in Our Signs, and they will bow in Islam.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 27:82: And when the Word is fulfilled against them (the unjust), we shall produce from the earth a beast to (face) them: He will speak to them, for that mankind did not believe with assurance in Our Signs.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 27:83: One day We shall gather together from every people a troop of those who reject our Signs, and they shall be kept in ranks,-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 27:84: Until, when they come (before the Judgment-seat), (God) will say: "Did ye reject My Signs, though ye comprehended them not in knowledge, or what was it ye did?"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 27:85: And the Word will be fulfilled against them, because of their wrong-doing, and they will be unable to speak (in plea).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 27:86: See they not that We have made the Night for them to rest in and the Day to give them light? Verily in this are Signs for any people that believe!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 27:87: And the Day that the Trumpet will be sounded - then will be smitten with terror those who are in the heavens, and those who are on earth, except such as God will please (to exempt): and all shall come to His (Presence) as beings conscious of their lowliness.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 27:88: Thou seest the mountains and thinkest them firmly fixed: but they shall pass away as the clouds pass away: (such is) the artistry of God, who disposes of all things in perfect order: for he is well acquainted with all that ye do.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 27:89: If any do good, good will (accrue) to them therefrom; and they will be secure from terror that Day.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 27:90: And if any do evil, their faces will be thrown headlong into the Fire: "Do ye receive a reward other than that which ye have earned by your deeds?"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 27:91: For me, I have been commanded to serve the Lord of this city, Him Who has sanctified it and to Whom (belong) all things: and I am commanded to be of those who bow in Islam to God’s Will,-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 27:92: And to rehearse the Qur’an: and if any accept guidance, they do it for the good of their own souls, and if any stray, say: "I am only a Warner".
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 27:93: And say: "Praise be to God, Who will soon show you His Signs, so that ye shall know them"; and thy Lord is not unmindful of all that ye do.

Arthur J. Arberry.verse 27:2: a guidance, and good tidings unto the believers
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 27:3: who perform the prayer, and pay the alms, and have sure faith in the Hereafter.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 27:4: Those who believe not in the Hereafter, We have decked out fair for them their works, and they wander blindly;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 27:5: those are they whom an evil chastisement awaits, and they will be the greatest losers in the Hereafter.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 27:6: Thou receivest the Koran from One All-wise, All-knowing.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 27:7: When Moses said to his people ’I observe a fire, and will bring you news of it, or I will bring you a flaming brand, that haply you shall warm yourselves.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 27:8: So, when he came to it, he was called: ’Blessed is he who is in the fire, and he who is about it.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 27:9: Moses, behold, it is I, God, the All-mighty, the All-wise.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 27:11: save him who has done evil, then; after evil, has changed into good; All-forgiving am I, All-compassionate.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 27:12: Thrust thy hand in thy bosom and it will come forth white without evil-among nine signs to Pharaoh and his people; they are an ungodly people.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 27:13: But when Our signs came to them visibly, they said, ’This is a manifest sorcery’;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 27:14: and they denied them, though their souls acknowledged them, wrongfully and out of pride.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 27:15: And We gave David and Solomon knowledge and they said, ’Praise belongs to God who has preferred us over many of His believing servants.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 27:16: And Solomon was David’s heir, and he said, ’Men, we have been taught the speech of the birds, and we have been given of everything; surely this is indeed the manifest bounty.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 27:17: And his hosts were mustered to Solomon, jinn, men and birds, duly disposed;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 27:18: till, when they came on the Valley of Ants, an ant said, ’Ants, enter your dwelling-places, lest Solomon and his hosts crush you, being unaware!’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 27:19: But he smiled, laughing at its words, and he said, ’My Lord, dispose me that I may be thankful for Thy blessing wherewith Thou hast blessed me and my father and mother, and that I may do righteousness well-pleasing to Thee; and do Thou admit me, by Thy mercy, amongst Thy righteous servants.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 27:20: And he reviewed the birds; then he said, ’How is it with me, that I do not see the hoopoe? Or is he among the absent?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 27:21: Assuredly I will chastise him with a terrible chastisement, or I will slaughter him, or he bring me a clear authority.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 27:22: But he tarried not long, and said, ’I have comprehended that which thou hast not comprehended, and I have come from Sheba to thee with a sure tiding.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 27:23: I found a woman ruling over them, and she has been given of everything, and she possesses a mighty throne.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 27:24: I found her and her people prostrating to the sun, apart from God; Satan has decked out fair their deeds to them and he has barred them from the way, and therefore they are not guided,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 27:25: so that they prostrate not themselves to God, who brings forth what is hidden in the heavens and earth; and He knows what you conceal and what you publish.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 27:26: God: there is no god but He, the Lord of the Mighty Throne.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 27:27: Said he, ’Now We will see whether thou hast spoken truly, or whether thou art amongst those that lie.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 27:28: Take this letter of mine, and cast it unto them, then turn back from them and see what they shall return ’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 27:29: She said, ’O Council, see, a letter honourable has been cast unto me.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 27:30: It is from Solomon, and it is "In the Name of God, the Merciful, the Compassionate.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 27:31: Rise not up against me, but come to me in surrender.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 27:32: She said, ’O Council, pronounce to me concerning my affair; I am not used to decide an affair until you bear me witness.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 27:33: They said, ’We possess force and we possess great might.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 27:34: She said, ’Kings, when they enter a city, disorder it and make the mighty ones of its inhabitants abased.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 27:35: Now I will send them a present, and see what the envoys bring back.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 27:36: But when he came to Solomon he said, ’What, would you succour me with wealth, and what God gave me is better than what He has given you? Nay, but instead you rejoice in your gift!
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 27:37: Return thou to them; we shall assuredly come against them with hosts they have not power to resist, and we shall expel them from there, abased and utterly humbled.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 27:38: He said, ’O Council, which one of you will bring me her throne, before they come to me in surrender?’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 27:39: An efreet of the jinns said, ’I will bring it to thee, before thou risest from thy place; I have strength for it
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 27:41: He said, ’Disguise her throne for her, and we shall behold whether she is guided or if she is of those that are not guided.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 27:42: So, when she came, it was said, ’Is thy throne like this?’ She said, ’It seems the same.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 27:43: but that she served, apart from God, barred her, for she was of a people of unbelievers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 27:44: It was said to her, ’Enter the pavilion.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 27:45: And We sent to Thamood their brother Salih: ’Serve you God!’ And behold, they were two parties, that were disputing one with another.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 27:46: He said, ’O my people, why do you seek to hasten evil before good? Why do you not ask forgiveness of God? Haply so you will find mercy.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 27:47: They said, ’We augur ill of thee and of those that are with thee.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 27:48: Now in the city there were nine persons who did corruption in the land, and put not things right;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 27:49: they said, ’Swear you, one to another, by God, "We will attack him and his family by night, then we will tell his protector, We were not witnesses of the destruction of his family; and assuredly we are truthful men.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 27:50: And they devised a device, and We likewise devised a device, while they were not aware;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 27:51: and behold, how was the end of their device! For We destroyed them and their people all together.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 27:52: Those are their houses, all fallen down because of the evil they committed; surely in that is a sign for a people who have knowledge.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 27:53: And We delivered those who believed and were godfearing.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 27:54: And Lot, when he said to his people, ’What, do you commit indecency with your eyes open?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 27:55: What, do you approach men lustfully instead of women? No, you are a people that are ignorant.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 27:56: And the only answer of his people was that they said, ’Expel the folk of Lot from your city; they are men that keep themselves clean!’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 27:57: So We delivered him and his family, except his wife; We decreed she should be of those that tarried.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 27:58: And We rained on them a rain; and evil indeed is the rain of them that are warned.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 27:59: Say: ’Praise belongs to God, and peace be on His servants whom He has chosen.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 27:60: He who created the heavens and earth, and sent down for you out of heaven water; and We caused to grow therewith gardens full of loveliness whose trees you could never grow.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 27:61: He who made the earth a fixed place and set amidst it rivers and appointed for it firm mountains and placed a partition between the two seas.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 27:62: He who answers the constrained, when he calls unto Him, and removes the evil and appoints you to be successors in the earth.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 27:63: He who guides you in the shadows of the land and the sea and looses the winds, bearing good tidings before His mercy.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 27:64: Who originates creation, then brings it back again, and provides you out of heaven and earth.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 27:65: Say: ’None knows the Unseen in the heavens and earth except God.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 27:66: nay, but their knowledge fails as to the Hereafter; nay, they are in doubt of it; nay, they are blind to it.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 27:67: The unbelievers say, ’What, when we are dust, and our fathers, shall we indeed be brought forth?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 27:68: We have been promised this, and our fathers before; this is naught but the fairy-tales of the ancients.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 27:69: Say: ’Journey in the land, then behold how was the end of the sinners.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 27:70: Do not sorrow for them, nor be thou straitened for what they devise.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 27:71: They say, ’When shall this promise come to pass, if you speak the truth?’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 27:72: Say: ’It may be that riding behind you already is some part of that you seek to hasten on.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 27:73: Surely thy Lord is bountiful to men; but most of them are not thankful.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 27:74: Surely thy Lord knows what their hearts conceal, and what they publish.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 27:75: And not a thing is there hidden in heaven and earth but it is in a Manifest Book.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 27:76: Surely this Koran relates to the Children of Israel most of that concerning which they are at variance;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 27:77: it is a guidance, and a mercy unto the believers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 27:78: Surely thy Lord will decide between them by His Judgment; He is the All-mighty, the All-knowing.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 27:79: So put thy trust in God; thou art upon the manifest truth.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 27:80: Thou shalt not make the dead to hear, neither shalt thou make the deaf to hear the call when they turn about, retreating.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 27:81: Thou shalt not guide the blind out of their error neither shalt thou make any to hear, save such as believe in Our signs, and so surrender.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 27:82: When the Word falls on them, We shall bring forth for them out of the earth a beast that shall speak unto them: ’Mankind had no faith in Our signs.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 27:83: Upon the day when We shall muster out of every nation a troop of those that cried lies to Our signs, duly disposed,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 27:84: till, when they are come, He shall say, ’Did you cry lies to My signs, not comprehending them in knowledge, or what have you been doing?’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 27:85: And the Word shall fall upon them because of the evil they committed, while they speak naught.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 27:86: Have they not seen how We made the night for them, to repose in it, and the day, to see? Surely in that is a sign for a people who are believers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 27:87: On the day the Trumpet is blown, and terrified is whosoever is in the heavens and earth, excepting whom God wills, and every one shall come to Him, all utterly abject;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 27:88: and thou shalt see the mountains, that thou supposest fixed, passing by like clouds -- God’s handiwork, who has created everything very well.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 27:89: Whosoever comes with a good deed, he shall have better than it; and they shall be secure from terror that day.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 27:90: And whosoever comes with an evil deed, their faces shall be thrust into the Fire: ’Are you recompensed but for what you did?’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 27:91: I have only been commanded to serve the Lord of this territory which He has made sacred; to Him belongs everything.

Muhammad Asad.verse 27:2: a guidance and a glad tiding to the believers
Muhammad Asad.verse 27:3: who are constant in prayer and spend in charity: for it is they, they who in their innermost are certain of the life to come!
Muhammad Asad.verse 27:4: As for those who will not believe in the life to come – behold, goodly have We made their own doings appear unto them, and so they stumble blindly to and fro.
Muhammad Asad.verse 27:5: It is they whom the worst of suffering awaits: for it is they, they who in the life to come shall be the greatest losers!
Muhammad Asad.verse 27:6: But [as for thee, O believer,] verily, thou hast received this Qur’ān out of the grace of One who is wise.
Muhammad Asad.verse 27:7: LO! [While lost in the desert,] Moses said to his family: "Behold, I perceive a fire [far away]; I may bring you from there some tiding [as to which way we are to pursue], or bring you [at least] a burning brand so that you might warm yourselves.
Muhammad Asad.verse 27:8: But when he came close to it, a call was sounded: "Blessed are all who are within [reach of] this fire, and all who are near it! And limitless in His glory is God, the Sustainer of all the worlds!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 27:9: [And God spoke thus:] "O Moses! Verily, I alone am God, the Almighty, the Wise!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 27:10: [And then He said:] "Now throw down thy staff!" But when he saw it move rapidly, as if it were a serpent, he drew back [in terror], and did not [dare to] return.
Muhammad Asad.verse 27:11: and neither need anyone who has done wrong and then has replaced the wrong with good: for, verily, I am much-forgiving, a dispenser of grace!
Muhammad Asad.verse 27:12: "Now place thy hand into thy bosom: it will come forth
Muhammad Asad.verse 27:13: white, without blemish! "[And thou shalt go] with nine [of My] messages unto Pharaoh and his people – for, verily, they are people depraved!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 27:14: But when Our light-giving messages came unto them, they said, "This is clearly
Muhammad Asad.verse 27:16: and in their wickedness and self-exaltation they rejected them, although their minds were convinced of their truth: and behold what happened in the end to those spreaders of corruption!
Muhammad Asad.verse 27:18: knowledge unto David and Solomon [as well]; and both were wont to say: "All praise is due to God, who has
Muhammad Asad.verse 27:19: favoured us above many of His believing servants!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 27:21: David’s heir; and he would say: "O you people! We have been taught the speech of birds, and have been given [in abundance] of all
Muhammad Asad.verse 27:22: things: this, behold, is indeed a manifest favour [from God]!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 27:23: And [one day] there were assembled before Solomon his hosts of invisible beings, and of men, and of birds; and then they were led forth in orderly ranks,

Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 27:2: a guidance and good news to the believers
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 27:3: who establish Salāh and pay Zakāh and who have faith in the Hereafter.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 27:4: As for those who do not believe in the Hereafter, We have made their deeds look beautiful to them.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 27:5: Those are the people who deserve the worst punishment and who are the worst losers in the Hereafter.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 27:6: Indeed you are being given the Qur’ān by a Wise, Knowledgeable Being.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 27:7: (Remember) when Mūsā said to his family, “I have noticed a fire.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 27:8: So when he came to it, he was called: “Blessed is the one who is in the fire and the one who is around it.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 27:9: O Mūsā, the fact is that I AM ALLAH, the Mighty, the Wise.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 27:11: except him who did wrong, then after (having done) evil, replaced (it) with good, then I am Most-Forgiving, Very-Merciful.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 27:12: And put your hand into your bosom, and it will come out white, without any evil, as one of the nine signs (sent) to Pharaoh and his people.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 27:13: So when Our signs came to them as eye-openers, they said, “This is a clear magic.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 27:14: And they denied them out of sheer injustice and arrogance, though their hearts believed them (to be true).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 27:15: Surely We gave knowledge to Dāwūd and Sulaimān, and they said, “Praise belongs to Allah who made us excel many of His believing servants.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 27:16: And Sulaimān inherited (the traits of) Dāwūd and said, “O people we have been taught the speech of birds, and all sorts of things are given to us.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 27:17: And mustered for Sulaimān were his forces from among the Jinns and the humans and the birds.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 27:18: until when they reached the valley of the ants, one of the ants said, “O ants, enter your dwelling places, lest Sulaimān and his armies crush you unknowingly.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 27:19: So he (Sulaimān) smiled, laughing on her speech and said, “My Lord, enable me to become grateful to Your favor that you have bestowed on me and on my parents, and to do good deeds that You like, and admit me, with Your mercy, among Your righteous servants.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 27:20: And (once) he (Sulaimān) checked the birds and said, “How is it with me that I do not see the hudhud (hoopoe)? Rather he has disappeared.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 27:21: I will punish him with a severe punishment or slaughter him unless he brings to me a clear plea.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 27:22: Then the hoopoe did not take long and said (to Sulaimān), “I have discovered what you did not, and have brought to you a sure information from Saba’ (Sheba).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 27:23: I have found a woman ruling over them, and all sorts of things are given to her, and she has a great throne.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 27:24: I have found her and her people prostrating themselves to the sun, instead of Allah, and the Satan has beautified their deeds for them, and has prevented them from the way, so they do not take the right path,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 27:25: that is, they do not prostrate to Allah who brings forth what is hidden in the heavens and the earth,-and who knows whatever you conceal and whatever you reveal.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 27:26: Allah! There is no god but He, the Lord of the Great Throne.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 27:27: He (Sulaimān) said, “We shall see whether you have told the truth or you are one of the liars.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 27:28: Go with this letter of mine, and deliver it down to them, then turn back from them, and see how they react.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 27:29: She (the queen) said (to her officials after receiving the letter), “O chieftains, there has been delivered to me an esteemed letter.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 27:30: It is from Sulaimān, and it is (in the following words :) With the name of Allah, the All-Merciful, the Very-Merciful.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 27:31: Do not rebel against me, and come to me in submission.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 27:32: She said, “O chieftains, advise me in the matter I have (before me).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 27:33: They said, “We are powerful and tough fighters, and the decision lies with you; so consider what command you should give.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 27:34: She said, “In fact when the kings enter a town, they put it to disorder, and put its honorable citizens to disgrace, and this is how they normally do.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 27:35: And I am going to send a gift to them, then see, what response the envoys will bring back.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 27:36: So when he (the envoy) came to Sulaimān, he said, “Are you extending a financial aid to me? So what Allah has given me is much better than what He has given to you.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 27:37: Go back to them, and we will bring to them forces they have no power to face, and we will certainly drive them out from there in humiliation while they are disgraced.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 27:38: He said, “O chieftains, which one of you will bring her throne to me before they come to me submissively?”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 27:39: A stalwart of the Jinn said, “I will bring it to you before you rise up from your place, and for this (task) I am powerful, reliable.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 27:40: Said the one who had the knowledge of the book, “I will bring it to you before your glance returns to you.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 27:41: He said, “Disguise the throne for her, and we will see whether she discovers the truth, or she does not recognize it.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 27:42: So when she came, it was said (to her), “Is your throne like this?” She said, “It seems to be the same.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 27:43: And she was prevented (from submitting before this) by that which she used to worship instead of Allah.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 27:44: It was said to her, “Enter the palace.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 27:45: And We sent to Thamūd their brother SāliH saying (to them), “Worship Allah”.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 27:46: He said, “My people, why do you seek evil to come sooner before good? Why do you not seek forgiveness from Allah, so that you are treated with mercy?”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 27:47: They said, “We regard you and those with you as a sign of bad omen.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 27:48: And there were nine persons in the city who used to make mischief on the earth and did not put things right.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 27:49: They said, “Let us swear a mutual oath by Allah that we shall attack him (SāliH) and his family at night, then will say to his heir, ‘We did not witness the destruction of his family, and we are really truthful.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 27:50: Thus they devised a plan, and We devised a plan, while they were not aware.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 27:51: So, look how was the fate of their plan, that We annihilated them and their people altogether.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 27:52: Now those are their houses, lying empty because of their transgression.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 27:53: And We saved those who believed and who used to be God-fearing.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 27:54: And (We sent) LūT when he said to his people, “Do you commit the shameful act while you can see (its shamefulness)?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 27:55: Is it that you really come to men lustfully instead of women? No, you are a people committing acts of ignorance.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 27:56: So, the answer of his people was not else but that they said, “Expel the family of LūT from your town.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 27:57: So, We saved him and his family, except his wife.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 27:58: And We rained on them a rain.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 27:59: Say, “Praise belongs to Allah, and peace be on those of His servants whom He has chosen.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 27:60: Or the One who created the heavens and the earth and sent down for you water from the sky? Then We caused to grow with it gardens, full of glamour.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 27:61: Or the One who made the earth a place to settle and made rivers amidst it and made mountains for (making) it (firm), and made a barrier between two seas? Is there any god along with Allah? No, but most of them do not have knowledge.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 27:62: Or the One who responds to a helpless person when He prays to Him and removes distress, and who makes you vicegerents of the earth? Is there any god along with Allah? No, but little you heed to advice.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 27:63: Or the One who guides you in depths of darkness on land and sea, and who sends the winds bearing good news before His mercy? Is there any god along with Allah? Allah is far higher than the partners they ascribe to Him.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 27:64: Or the One who originated creation, then will reproduce it, and who gives you provision from the sky and the earth? Is there any god along with Allah? Say, “Bring your proof if you are true.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 27:65: Say, “No one in the heavens and the earth has the knowledge of the Unseen except Allah.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 27:66: Rather, their knowledge has failed in respect of the Hereafter.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 27:67: And said those who disbelieved, “Is it that, when we and our fathers become dust,-is it that we shall really be brought forth?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 27:68: Indeed, it was promised to us and to our fathers even before this.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 27:69: Say, “Travel in the land and see how was the fate of the sinners.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 27:70: And do not grieve for them, nor should your heart be straitened because of what they plan.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 27:71: They say, “When shall this promise come to pass if you are true?”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 27:72: Say, “It is not unlikely that some part of that (punishment) which you are asking to come soon is already following you closely.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 27:73: And surely, your Lord is graceful for the mankind, but most of the people are not grateful.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 27:74: Of course, your Lord knows for sure what their hearts conceal and what they reveal.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 27:75: There is nothing hidden in the heavens and the earth that is not (recorded) in a manifest book.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 27:76: Surely this Qur’ān mentions to the children of Isrā’īl most of the matters in which they dispute.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 27:77: It is guidance and mercy for the believers.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 27:78: And surely your Lord will decide between them by His judgment, and He is the All-Mighty, the All-Knowing.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 27:80: Surely, you cannot make the dead to hear, nor can you make the deaf to hear your call when they turn their backs in retreat,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 27:81: nor can you show the right path to the blind against their wandering astray.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 27:82: When the word will come to fall upon them, We will bring forth for them a beast from the earth who will speak to them that the human beings (i.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 27:83: And (remember) the day when We will gather from every nation a host of those who used to reject Our verses, and they will be kept under control.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 27:84: Until when they will come, He (Allah) will say, “Did you reject My verses while you did not comprehend them with knowledge, or what was it that you used to do?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 27:85: And the Word will come to fall on them because of their transgression, so they will not (be able to) speak.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 27:86: Did they not see that We made the night, so that they may have rest in it, and (made) the day to make them see? Surely, in this there are signs for a people who believe.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 27:87: And (remember) the day when the Horn will be blown; so all those in the heavens and the earth will be in panic, except those whom Allah wills.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 27:88: And you see the mountains (at present) supposing them as fixed (forever), while (on that Day) they will fly like the flight of clouds - an act of Allah who has perfected every thing.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 27:89: Whoever will come with the good deed will have (a reward) better than that, and such people will be immune on that day from any panic.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 27:90: And whoever will come with evil deed, the faces of such people will be thrown down into the Fire.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 27:91: I am but ordered to worship the Lord of this city, which is sanctified by Him.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 27:92: and to recite the Qur’ān; so whoever takes the right path, takes it for his own benefit.

Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 27:2: a guidance, and good tidings for the believers.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 27:3: Those who observe prayer and give alms and who are certain of the Hereafter.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 27:4: Truly those who do not believe in the Hereafter, We have adorned their deeds for them, and so they are bewildered.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 27:5: Those are they for whom there is an awful chastisement; and in the Hereafter they will be the greatest losers.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 27:6: And truly you are receiving the Qur’ān, from One Wise, Knowing.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 27:7: When Moses said to his family, 'Assuredly I notice a fire.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 27:8: But when he reached it, he was called [with the following words]: 'Blessed is he, who is in the fire, and who is around it, and Glory be to God, the Lord of the Worlds.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 27:9: O Moses, lo! it is I, God, the Mighty, the Wise.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 27:11: except him who has done wrong, but then changed [his wrong] for good after [having done] evil, then truly I am Forgiving, Merciful.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 27:12: And insert your hand into your bosom, and it will emerge white without any blemish.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 27:13: But when Our signs came to them plain to see, they said, 'This is manifest sorcery'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 27:14: And they denied them, though their souls had been convinced wrongfully and arrogantly.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 27:15: And verily We gave David and Solomon knowledge, and they said, 'Praise be to God Who has favoured us over many of His believing servants'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 27:16: And Solomon inherited from David, and he said, 'O people, we have been taught the speech of the birds, and we have been given of all things.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 27:17: And Solomon's hosts of jinn and humans and birds stood assembled for him as they were being arrayed.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 27:18: When they came to the Valley of the Ants, an ant said, 'O ants, enter your dwellings, lest Solomon and his hosts crush you while they are unaware!'
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 27:19: Whereat he smiled, amused at its words.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 27:20: And he reviewed the birds, then he said, 'Why is it that I do not see the hoopoe? Or is he among the absent?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 27:21: 'Assuredly I will chastise him with a severe chastisement, or I will slaughter him, unless he brings me a clear warrant'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 27:22: But he did not remain long [in absence], and he said, 'I have discovered something of which you have no knowledge, and I have brought you from Sheba a verified report.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 27:23: I found a woman ruling over them, and she has been given [an abundance] of all things, and she possesses a great throne.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 27:24: I found her and her people prostrating to the sun instead of God, and Satan has adorned for them their deeds and he has barred them from the Way, so that they are not guided
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 27:26: Who brings forth the hidden in the heavens and the earth, and He knows what they conceal and what they proclaim.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 27:27: God - there is no god except Him, the Lord of the Mighty Throne'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 27:28: He said, 'We shall see whether you have spoken the truth, or whether you are of the liars.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 27:29: Take this letter of mine and deliver it to them, then turn away from them and see what
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 27:31: She said, 'O [members of the] council, lo! a noble letter has been delivered to me.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 27:32: It is from Solomon and lo! it is: "In the Name of God, the Compassionate, the Merciful.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 27:33: Do not rise up against me [in defiance], but come to me in submission"'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 27:34: She said, 'O [members of the] council, give me an opinion in this matter of mine.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 27:35: They said, 'We possess force and we possess great might.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 27:36: She said, 'Indeed kings, when they enter a town, ruin it, and reduce the mightiest of its inhabitants to the most abased.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 27:37: Now I will send them a gift and wait to see with what
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 27:39: But when he came to Solomon, he said, 'Are you supplying me with wealth? What God has given me is better than what He has given you.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 27:40: Go back to them, for We shall assuredly come to them with hosts which they will not be able to face and we shall expel them from there humiliated, and they shall be utterly abased'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 27:41: He said, 'O [members of the] council, which of you will bring me her throne before they come to me in submission?'
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 27:42: An afreet from among the jinn said, 'I will bring it to you before you rise from your place.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 27:43: The one who had knowledge of the Scripture said: 'I will bring it to you before your glance returns to you.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 27:44: He said, 'Disguise her throne for her that we may see whether she will be guided, or be of those who cannot be guided'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 27:45: So when she came, it was said, 'Is your throne like this?' She said, 'It as though it is the one'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 27:46: And what she worshipped besides God barred her, for she belonged to disbelieving folk'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 27:47: It was said to her, 'Enter the palace '.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 27:48: And when she saw it, she supposed it to be a pool, and so she bared her legs.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 27:50: And verily We sent to Thamūd their brother Sālih: ‘Worship God!’ And lo! they
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 27:51: became two parties quarrelling with one another.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 27:52: He said, 'O my people, why do you [seek to] hasten on evil before
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 27:53: good? Why do you not ask God to forgive you, so that you might be shown mercy?'
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 27:54: They said, 'We augur evil of you and of those who are with you'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 27:55: And there were in the city a band of nine men, who were causing corruption in the land and did not reform [their ways].
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 27:56: They said, 'Swear to one another by God that we will attack him by night together with his folk.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 27:58: So they plotted a plot, but We
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 27:59: plotted a plot, while they were not aware.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 27:60: So behold how was the consequence of their plot! For lo! We destroyed them and all their people.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 27:61: So those then are their houses
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 27:62: deserted because of the evil which they did.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 27:63: And We delivered those who believed and were fearful.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 27:64: And Lot, when he said to his people, 'What! Do you commit
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 27:66: What! Do you come unto men in lust instead of women? Nay, but you are truly a people in ignorance'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 27:67: But the only response of his people was that they said, 'Expel Lot's family from your town.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 27:68: So We delivered him and his family, except his wife - We decreed
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 27:69: her to be of those who remained behind.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 27:70: Then We rained on them a rain.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 27:71: Say [O Muhammad]: ‘Praise be to God and peace be on His servants whom He has chosen’.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 27:72: Or He Who created the heavens and the earth, and sends down for you water from the heaven, whereby We cause to grow splendid gardens whose trees you could never cause to grow? Is there a god with God? Nay, but they are a people who ascribe equals [to Him].
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 27:73: Or He Who made the earth an abode [of stability] and made rivers [to flow] throughout it and set firm mountains for it, and set an isthmus between the two seas.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 27:74: Or He Who answers the desperate one when he calls to Him and Who removes
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 27:75: distress and makes you successors in the earth.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 27:76: Or He Who guides you in the darkness of the land and the sea and Who sends forth the winds as harbingers of His mercy.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 27:78: Or He Who originates creation then brings it back again, and Who provides for you from the heaven and
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 27:80: Say: 'No one in the heavens or the earth knows the Unseen, except God, and they are not aware when they will be resurrected.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 27:81: Nay, has their knowledge come to comprise the Hereafter? Nay, for they are in doubt of it.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 27:82: And the disbelievers say: 'What! When we and our fathers are dust shall we indeed be brought forth ?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 27:83: Already we and our fathers have been promised this before.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 27:86: Say: 'Travel in the land and see how was the sequel for the criminals'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 27:87: And do not grieve for them, and do not be distressed by their schemes.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 27:88: And they say, 'When will this promise be, if you are truthful?'
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 27:89: Say: 'It may be that part of what you seek to hasten on is close behind you'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 27:90: And surely your Lord is bountiful to mankind, but most of them are not thankful.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 27:91: And surely your Lord knows what their hearts conceal and what they proclaim.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 27:92: And there is not a thing hidden in the heaven and the earth but it is in a manifest Book.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 27:93: Truly this Qur’ān recounts to the Children of Israel [the means to resolve] most of that concerning which they differ.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 27:94: And truly it is a guidance and a mercy for believers.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 27:95: Surely your Lord will decide between them of His judgement.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 27:96: So rely on God, for you are indeed upon the manifest truth.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 27:97: Indeed you cannot make the dead hear, nor can you make the deaf hear the call when they have turned their backs [upon you];
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 27:98: nor can you lead the blind out of their error.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 27:99: And when the word [of judgement] falls upon them, We shall bring forth for them a beast from the earth which shall speak to them :
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 27:100: 'Indeed mankind had no faith in Our signs'.
